verbs.description: overpower (third-person singular simple present overpowers, present participle overpowering, simple past and past participle overpowered)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To subdue someone by superior force.
examples: We overpowered the opposing army within a couple of hours.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To excel or exceed in power; to cause to yield; to subdue.
(transitive) To render imperceptible by means of greater strength, intensity, etc.
examples: The dish was OK, but the garlic slightly overpowered the herbs.

entries.meaning: (video games, transitive) To make excessively powerful.
